---

## 3. CONTEXT-AWARE APEX TECH STACKS (LATE 2025 STANDARDS)
**Directives:** Detect the project type and apply the corresponding **Apex Toolchain**. This repository, **`MetaMind-Unified-AI-Search-Engine-Web-App`**, is a modern web application.

*   **PRIMARY SCENARIO A: WEB / APP / EXTENSION (TypeScript)**
    *   **Stack:** This project leverages **TypeScript 6.x** with **Strict Mode** enabled. The build tool is **Vite 7 (Rolldown)**. For styling, **Tailwind CSS v4** is utilized. The core framework is **React**, and for cross-platform desktop applications or browser extensions, **Tauri v2.x** and **WXT** are the preferred choices respectively. State management should employ **Signals (Standardized)**.
    *   **Linting & Formatting:** **Biome** is mandated for its speed and comprehensive rule set, ensuring code quality and consistency across the project.
    *   **Testing:** **Vitest** is the standard for unit and integration testing due to its compatibility with Vite. **Playwright** is used for End-to-End (E2E) testing to ensure a robust user experience.
    *   **Architecture:** Adheres to **Feature-Sliced Design (FSD)** principles for maintainable and scalable frontend architecture.
    *   **AI Integration:** The application interacts with various AI search APIs. Ensure robust error handling, efficient data fetching, and clear abstraction layers for each AI service.

---

## 4. VERIFICATION COMMANDS (Late 2025 Standard)

*   **Installation:**
    bash
    git clone https://github.com/chirag127/MetaMind-Unified-AI-Search-Engine-Web-App.git
    cd MetaMind-Unified-AI-Search-Engine-Web-App
    npm install # or yarn install, pnpm install
    

*   **Linting & Formatting:**
    bash
    npm run lint # or yarn lint, pnpm lint
    npm run format # or yarn format, pnpm format
    

*   **Unit & Integration Testing:**
    bash
    npm run test:unit # or yarn test:unit, pnpm test:unit
    

*   **End-to-End Testing:**
    bash
    npm run test:e2e # or yarn test:e2e, pnpm test:e2e
    

*   **Development Server:**
    bash
    npm run dev # or yarn dev, pnpm dev
    

*   **Build:**
    bash
    npm run build # or yarn build, pnpm build
    

---

## 5. ARCHITECTURAL PRINCIPLES

*   **SOLID:** Adhere strictly to **S**ingle Responsibility, **O**pen/Closed, **L**iskov Substitution, **I**nterface Segregation, and **D**ependency Inversion principles.
*   **DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself):** Eliminate redundant code and logic.
*   **YAGNI (You Ain't Gonna Need It):** Implement only necessary features to avoid over-engineering.
*   **KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid):** Favor simplicity and clarity in design and implementation.
